WRITING.TEXT: Well, yesterday was my first day, I had 346 calories which consisted of basically eggs and coconut oil. I lost 1.4 pounds since yesterday. I'm guessing most of that is water weight but holy hell I like keto! I feel so much fuller eating fat + protein compared to any amount of carb. I stayed full for like 4.5 hours after eating 2 eggs with coconut oil.

Keto Day 2!
Breakfast: 2 whole eggs (140) + 10g coconut oil (86)
Lunch: Nothing
Dinner: 2 cups baby arugula (20) + 3 oz chicken breast (90) + 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice (13) + 7g butter (50)
Total: 399
I've been feeling slightly nauseated since starting keto. I attribute this to the fact that I'm not used to eating so much fat. Is this normal? Will it go away eventually?

You know what, I looked into it and there are some jerkys with only 3g carbs! I'm only on day 2 of keto. I plan on going all week and seeing how I feel. If I like it and decide to stick with it, I'll add jerky to my grocery list for next week!

But I heard that in the US there are quite few people smoking!
There is *definitely* a huge stigma against cigarette smoking in the US. It's getting less and less common. It's rare to see anyone smoking in public. I live in Vegas, so it's a bit different. But when I go back to Chicago no one is out on the street smoking.

Yeah I was just going to say. Especially in London, so many people would smoke. In the business area, people would get off work, stand outside with beer and wine and almost everyone had a cigarette in hand.

plan meals so that you're eating a protein bar or something while you're with them
I've started doing that. Well, I did it once. I mixed a protein shake and had a stick of cheese in front of one of my trainers. Not sure if she saw me eat/drink, but I tried!!! I can't really do that anymore as I've started keto and so far all the food I eat has to be cooked beforehand.

Height: 5'1"
CW: 112.6
HW: 158
LW: 87-92 (my mom took my scale away at 92 but I still lost weight, hence the range)
GW: 100
UGW: 85
WL: 21.4 in total
BMI: 22.22 (new), 21.28 (old)
Age: 22
Gender expression: F
I started keto yesterday and I cannot believe I'm down 1.4 pounds since yesterday, despite having 346 calories (usually a 1+ pound drop only happens if I've only consumed liquids the day before). I almost refuse to believe I've lost that much weight. I'm going to buy a second scale today to confirm my weight.

My problem is my close friend let it slip to both of my horse trainers that I've had an eating disorder in the past. Now that they know that, I kind of walk on eggshells around them. When I go to the barn I *try* to wear clothes that'll hide my weight loss. It's awkward because I know that they know about my ED, but they don't know that I know they know. Wow what a clusterfuck of a sentence!

I just feel very lucky that I've always somehow managed to stay pretty healthy and don't have long term negative effects and idk want to keep things that way to the extent possible.
That's the most important thing, babe! I'm really proud of you for having a rational side to yourself while dealing with an ED.
I have it set in stone that my GW is 85. For my height, that's not *horribly* underweight. But I have a lot of people who care about me (lol I'm saying that like it's a bad thing) and I feel like if I even dipped below 90 it would raise a lot of eyebrows. Especially being an athlete and all, I fear my trainers will refuse to train me if I don't eat or something.
Over on /r/fatlogic the commenters think "if you have fat on your body then you won't run out of nutrients" it's honestly like they're spouting reverse fatlogic.

Yes and what drives me insane is their perception of eating disorders and stuff. They think that if someone has a restrictive-type eating disorder and they're not underweight, then it's not an issue. Like dude you can still get serious medical complications from regular/consistent restricting even if you're not severely underweight.

Yeah they can be really set in their ways and encourage borderline ED behaviors, and take things *way* too seriously, too. Yesterday they linked an article from Total Sorority Move called "Reasons NOT to date a fit guy" or something. The article was *clearly* satire, but everyone was taking it *so* seriously. They really like to dig and make something out of nothing. I appreciate them shedding light on *actual* fatlogic, but the commenters can be really fucking toxic.

Ah, I see. Well in Europe you're kinda forced to walk everywhere. Yes there are taxis (super duper pricey!) and Uber there now (I didn't take Uber when I was there though). I took the train only if something was 3+ miles away. But even when I'd take the train, I would still walk 1-3 miles sometimes to get to my actual destination.

If it helps, I went to London 2 summers ago for ~2 weeks and I found myself not eating *that* much and walking a LOT. On average, 17k steps per day. Basically I would wake up in the morning, have a chocolate bar (Kinder Bueno is delicious omg) and latte from Starbucks, go do touristy things while walking around all day, and at around 4pm/5pm I'd have a normal sized dinner at a restaurant. If I got hungrier later at night, I'd have a glass or two of wine or a cocktail and call it a day. I gained 3 pounds (mostly water weight) in those 2 weeks but within 2 days of restricting I was back down to my pre-London weight. Occasionally I would indulge in a treat while doing touristy things like an ice cream cone, crepe, piece of fresh bread, but it wasn't every day.
Yes! I check /r/fatlogic every day honestly.

I had gained weight with recovery + quitting smoking. I decided to lose the weight the healthy way (1000-1400 calories a day, HIIT, lifting). It was going well but I'd find myself eating 800 then 700 then 600 then hardly anything. I *had* to count calories and weigh/measure all my food to lose the weight and it just triggered so many ED thoughts and behaviors. So here I am.
I totally get it! Like you *want* to go lower but fear it's a slippery slope.
Avocado brownies?? I will have to look into that! And I'm so happy right now because it's been 3 hours since I had my omelette and I'm *still* satiated!
Thanks!

Okay so I fucked around with MFP and created the perfect keto week. Literally all I'm having is chicken, eggs and bacon for protein and butter and coconut oil for fats. The occasional whole egg for added fat, too. Oh, also lemon juice (fresh) and baby arugula! I'm quite excited. I'm doing a trial keto day today and I had 2 whole eggs as an omelette cooked in 7g coconut oil and it was really good! I had it 2 hours ago and I'm still very satiated.

Have you tried keto? I don't binge much but I have heard that keto has helped prevent others from bingeing! I semi started today (limited on foods so I can't hit the macros exactly) but I'm going food shopping tomorrow and planning my food for the week to be low cal and keto!
Yep! Exams are coming up for me in 2 weeks. Good luck!
Omg yes we are so similar!!! Good luck to you, too 3 3
Good luck to you, too! 3

WRITING.TITLE: Happy 1st day of May!
WRITING.TEXT:
**Is there anything you plan on changing this month? What are your goals this month?**
For me, I would *really* like to be down 14 pounds by the end of May/weigh in at 100 pounds. I weighed in at 114 this morning (YAS only 3 pounds away from my lowest adult weight). I'm also going to try a week of keto to see if that helps with water weight and things like that. If I like it, then I might just stick with it. I don't have any social obligations this month aside from a date with this guy on Thursday, so hopefully nothing else ruins my progress like the 2 social weekends I had in April did.

Yes! Apparently Trader Joe's has already riced cauliflower that you just add to a pan and cook how you like.
And yeah it's sooo hard to get over the fat = bad concept. I guess I just have to remind myself that fat + carbs = bad but fat + protein = good.

Yeah my mom is a doctor and in the past with my ED, she would just get angry with me and not try to understand at all. When I was a teen and first diagnosed with anorexia, she had me in the ER within an hour and an NG tube up my nose :| Fortunately, she doesn't live near me anymore and I am an adult, so she can't force that upon me. But she does control my finances and I fear one day she'll say "You need to eat/gain weight or I won't put money in your account anymore."
Bacon is suuuuch a great source of protein and fat. Could do without the nitrates, but, eh.

Breakfast: Nothing
Lunch: 2 whole eggs + 7g coconut oil
Dinner: 3 egg whites + 11g coconut oil
Total: 346
Trying keto today!

Going to switch to higher fat dairy as well, even if it means I won't be able to have as much.
Yep this is what I was thinking of last night! I usually buy 0% Fage Greek yog but I might buy full fat or 2% just to meet that fat goal.
I've even been thinking about getting that pre-cooked/microwaveable bacon (35 cal a slice) and have that with an egg for breakfast. 1 egg + 2 strips of that bacon would come out to a 140 cal breakfast, which isn't too bad.
Agh people always talk about avocado but for some reason I just can't stomach it! I know, I'm strange. Everyone loves avocado, right? The consistency just throws me off.

You are spot on. Therapy is not useful if the patient/client is not willing. I had started seeing my ED therapist again because I hate the relapse I'm going through. We had another session scheduled. I cancelled our second session and straight up told her it would be a waste of her time and my time because I'm not *willing* right now.

Yeah I'm thinking I might have to cut calories somewhere else and add oil or butter when it comes to cooking my eggs and chicken. Usually I use non-stick spray but that's just not going to cut it I suppose! I'm kind of freaking out about eating fats like oils and butters, but I know it'll be much better than eating carbs.

Try not to take it too seriously! I know, easier said than done. My "good" scale, which I broke, was super accurate. I put a 15 pound dumbbell on it and it read it as 15.0. I have a second scale and it reads *everything* 1.6 pounds higher (it read the same 15 pound dumbbell as 16.6!).
I'll look for it! I've seen another Eat Smart scale on Amazon and it seems to be their best selling scale.

I actually have a second scale. My mom left it in the house when she moved so unfortunately I can't break it because it belongs to her! Her scale reads everything 1.6 pounds higher and...I've lost a pound since yesterday! I can't believe it. But oddly enough I didn't get the high I'm used to getting from dropping a large amount of weight overnight. Maybe because I was so upset yesterday. Maybe I just feel guilty for losing weight? I don't know.
We're going to this Mexican restaurant that I'm familiar with. I'm planning on getting chicken fajitas with extra chicken and no rice, beans, etc. I'll just tell him I'm doing keto (which isn't a lie, I'm actually planning on trying keto this coming week). And yes! In the past when I'd restrict and still go out to eat, I'd make my restaurant meal the only thing I eat that day. I might have a cup of yoghurt or something earlier in the day because I have a riding lesson and I can't do that on an empty stomach.
I really want to be able to get comfortable with the idea of maintenance. As much as I *love* losing lots of weight rapidly, I don't think I can continue doing that unless I want to be semi-forced into IP. I'm thinking *maybe* once I hit 105 I'm going to think about maintaining for a few weeks.
3
I messed around with MFP using keto macros last night and I'm finding it *so* hard to get the right amount of fat! I have 10% too much protein then 10% too little fat.
Thighs have more fat compared to breast, right? I messed with MFP yesterday and tried to plan days for keto but I have way too much protein and not enough fat.

Yas!!! I was thinking 2 tablespoons of peanut butter with some celery for "lunch" would be a good amount of fat and be under 200 calories. How many grams of carbs do you eat per day? I'm going to fumble on MFP and see if I can come up with combinations so I'm under 20g of carbs a day.

If you eat below maintenance every day, you will lose weight. Full stop.
Ugh I try to remind myself that, especially since I eat 1100-1300 calories below maintenance every day! I guess the biggest thing with restrictive type eating disorders is the high you get when you see massive drops. I *live* for that high. Not seeing that massive drop doesn't give me the high, and it makes me feel like shit :(
I'm really trying to minimize ED thoughts/attitudes outside of restriction, I guess as a form of harm reduction.
I had been letting myself have my daily beer or glass of wine only if I had a good weigh in
These are both really good points. In the past when I'd have relapses with my eating disorder, I would still drink a glass or two of wine at night and I would still go out and have meals with friends, then just go back to restricting the following day - I didn't feel bad about eating a 1200 calorie meal in one sitting. But my relapse has gotten *so bad* to the point where I'm isolating myself completely. I don't see my friends anymore, not even if it's just to hang out at their house, because I fear food will be involved.
On the bright side, I have a dinner date scheduled with this guy next Thursday. It'll be one of those times where that dinner is all I eat for the day, then I go back to restriction the following day. Sure, restriction isn't good, but at least there's a *chance* where I'll be more willing to lead a semi normal life and not let my disordered eating get in the way...does that even make sense? Like, as you said, harm reduction. It's one thing to restrict your intake but it's another thing to allow your eating disorder to consume *every little* part of your life, which is what is happening to me right now.
Which scale is it you have? And yeah I've never had one of those bf% scales because I know seeing a bf% will make matters worse for me.
Thank you so much for your words of support!!! 3 3

Thank you so much for the spreadsheet! I'll download it and dabble with it tomorrow. I think my issue is that I weigh and measure way too often. I mean, I think I'll stick with weighing every day (once I get a new scale, that is. I intentionally broke my scale today and now I feel like shit!). I take my measurements with measuring tape every day, but I might feel better doing that only once a week.

I do feel slightly more bloated than usual, so that's definitely possible. And you know what, I've been thinking about trying keto for a week to start with. I do my food shopping on Monday and I'm going to try to buy high fat high protein foods. The only reason I've been consuming quite a few carbs lately is because I had been trying to finish up all my safe foods (which were all carb laden) before my next grocery store trip.
What are some keto safe foods you stick to? So far my keto list includes almond milk, eggs, peanut butter, string cheese and Greek yoghurt.

Omg!!! This is kind of me with egg whites. Egg whites (in the form of an omelette) have been my #1 safe food lately. This week, whenever I've had them, I've felt so so sick. Like, I look forward to eating them because it's my only real "meal", but then I eat it and I feel sick to my stomach.

I weigh myself daily and enter it on MFP and HappyScale. Overall the trend is down. The only time my weight was actually *up* was when I had soup for dinner one night, the following morning I was up 0.4 pounds! No longer having soup, and though my weight has consistently been dropping, it's not dropping as much as it used to :/

Ah! Thank you so much for this. You are amazing as always 3
Yeah 18.8 pounds ago my TDEE was 1800 and now it's 1600-1700 (depending on what calculator I use). I use Happy Scale and it *does* help me see an overall trend but stupid ED brain likes to see massive drops in weight every day. Hopefully everything balances out soon enough!

Oh no that's the worst! When someone catches on to your ED and indirectly pressures you to eat and stuff. I'm so sorry to hear about that! Maybe order something with lots of protein and specifically ask for double protein (e.g. chicken) so it doesn't look like you're trying to eat as little as possible?

Jesus Christ I have no idea why someone down voted this (it was at 67%), I feel like some posts on this sub are being brigaded?
Anyways. I am in a similar predicament as I have a first date on Thursday :3 we are going to a Mexican restaurant so I'm thinking I'll get some chicken fajitas with no tortilla, rice, beans, etc. I find that grilled meat + veggies is the safest thing. If you skip on the carbs like I plan on doing, just tell you friends you're trying to eat low carb/keto? That's what I'm planning on telling my date if he asks.
What kind of restaurant are you going to? I find steakhouses, Mexican and Indian restaurants to be the safest because they tend to always have grilled/roasted/baked lean meats.

At least they don't really have anywhere to go, except down. __^
Ah! That's a good point! I'll think about that whenever I feel bad about progress.
Holy crap that's awesome! Congrats! Unfortunately I seem to lose in my thighs last. I've lost almost 19 pounds in the last 1.5 months and I've only lost an inch from my thighs :3
Awesome!!! Have a blast!
Yes you were mentioning the archery a little while ago! Go for it!!!

Eek! I'm planning to go to Target and buy a new scale first thing Monday, unless someone is able to give me a good recommendation for one I can order on Amazon before then.
The love hate relationship for the scale is the absolute worst /3 I texted my therapist because I'm in *such* a horrible place right now and she said "Glad you smashed that piece of shit scale" haha it made me laugh. But now I miss it :/
3 3 3 always here for you babe

WRITING.TITLE: Well folks, I broke my scale.
WRITING.TEXT:
I had been only consuming liquids today. I had 2 cups of coffee and a protein shake. I don't know why I weighed myself. I didn't expect the number to be lower than this morning because I know I have lots of liquids in my system. I weighed in at 1 pound higher than this morning, which I expected.
After that I just lost it. I stomped on my scale really hard because I was so angry. Angry that I'm a slave to this stupid device. I hopped back on and it stopped working. I put new batteries in it and it gave me fucked up readings (e.g. 56 pounds at one point then 23 pounds at another point). I was fed up. So I threw it on the ground. Hard. I went to the garage and threw it around some more until it totally shattered.
I feel relieved but at the same time I'm *fucking terrified*. Now I can't weigh myself. I have another scale but it's horribly inaccurate. I can't afford to buy another scale until Monday and it kills me to not be able to weigh myself tomorrow *and* it kills me that a new scale I might buy may also be horribly inaccurate. I loved my scale. But I hated it, too, so I killed it.
On that note, any scale recommendations? The most accurate in your opinion?
I'm going to cry now. I hate this disease, this disorder. I wish I could be normal. I feel like dying.
**Edit:** Mods? I guess delete this post if it somehow breaks the rules?

My TDEE is around 1700 so I'm already at a really large deficit. Ugh this is so frustrating, honestly I want to scream. I could cry right now. But thank you so much for all the information you gave me 3 at least I know I'm not *technically* doing anything wrong.

you're also losing muscle
I'm an athlete and have worked *so* hard to put on the muscle I currently have! Will eating more protein help lose fat instead of muscle?
At this point I'm thinking I might start having to hit the gym again which is a fuckkkking pain because I'm eating so low cal, I hardly have any energy to go to the gym, especially since I still ride 4x a week. Do thinks like having a higher cal day help at all? Say I were to eat 800 one day then the next go back down to 350-400, would the drop in weight loss be dramatic like it used to be? I remember after 1 day of coffee fasting I dropped 1.2 pounds in 24-36 hours. I miss that :/

Firstly, thank you so much for taking the time to type this out and explain it to me!
Secondly, AGHH. This fucking blows. And like, I'm not even at a very low weight! My BMI is 21.7. More than anything, what's killing my vibe is the *high* I get from dropping large amounts of weight rapidly. Like, I may as well be eating at a 750 cal deficit instead of a 1500 cal deficit! It's so frustrating.
It's *possible*. I still do have BM's every day but I did notice that this morning my BM was smaller than usual, especially considering I ate a higher amount of calories (450) yesterday.

WRITING.TITLE: Lower calorie restricting is slowing down my weight loss - is there logic to this or am I being crazy?
WRITING.TEXT:
So for the past week I haven't gone above 500 calories. My average I'd say is around 350. I'm losing at a really really slow rate. Since Sunday I'm down 1.6 pounds. About a month ago I was eating 400-650 calories and I was losing 3+ pounds per week.
I'm weighing things that need to be weighed and logging every single calorie. I don't understand. Has anyone experienced this? Is it because I weigh (slightly) less now, the weight loss is slowing down? I'm not eating high sodium either, besides the cup of soup I had on Monday (which I realized was a huge mistake and I'm no longer consuming soup).
I only lost 0.2 pounds since yesterday (usually it's 0.4-0.6 per day) so I'm only consuming liquids today (still counting the calories, 300 calories worth of liquids today and that's it). Hopefully I see a great loss on the scale tomorrow.
Sounds delicious! I love a good filet mignon every now and then!
Yep! Also, OP, it looks like a 6 oz filet is even less calories than the chicken!

Their nutrition information is listed [here](https://www.outback.com/nutrition). You can build your meal and it shows you the calories. I did a quick meal builder and looks like you can get their Chicken on the Barbie with a side of asparagus and a side salad (the entree comes with 2 sides) and your meal will be under 500 calories. Get the BBQ sauce on the side and I'd imagine it'll be even less. They also have an entire 'Under 600' section you should look at.
Really, any grilled meat with sauces on the side + a veggie side dish would be safe.

Breakfast: Nothing
Lunch: Protein shake (150)
Dinner: Protein shake (150)
Total: 300
The scale was up 0.4 pounds this morning and I'm not sure why. None of my food from yesterday had a lot of sodium even. I'm just drinking protein shakes today to see if that'll help move the number on the scale tomorrow.
Edit: Just weighed myself again. I'm actually down 0.2 pounds since yesterday. I'm still going to stick to liquids today to see if I can get a greater loss by tomorrow.
I just separate them myself on the odd chance I want to include a yolk if I'm lacking fat in my diet.

These are all really good points. Especially with the goal weights - when I was 87-92 when I was 14, I still looked *really* skinny fat. So I might find that I don't need to go as low as I'm thinking I do considering I have *so* much more muscle now.

I haven't actually had alcohol in a long time but I feel like shots of hard liquor would go a long way? Especially if you've been restricting/fasting, it wouldn't take too much alcohol to get you sloshed. I have a very low tolerance for alcohol even if I've restricted to a higher amount of calories (e.g. 800).
Yeah I'm guessing my situation is attributed to my lifestyle since I've been much more active in the last 2 years.
Hi! Welcome! So so so sorry to hear about all the medical problems you've had to go through. I hope you find this community to be the support you need 3
They are my more recent safe food. I eat them almost every day. Unfortunately, I'm starting to get sick of them so I need to find something else for "dinner" :/

I was on ortho tri cyclen lo 2 years and never had any issues with weight gain. I was still able to restrict and lose weight. I've been off it for a little over a year now since I'm not sleeping with any men, though I've been thinking about getting back on it to help ease my periods. Though I didn't have any weight related side effects when I first started it, I do worry about the possibility of weight gain/water retention/increased appetite.
I've been kind of depressed lately and I've been thinking about asking my doctor to put me on Prozac again. I didn't experience any weight related issues in the past with it but I still have a fear something might go wrong.

I have BPD in addition to an eating disorder (well, you could say eating disorders and BPD go hand in hand). I've never really struggled with addiction though I have a very addictive personality. I went through a phase in college where I was doing close to a gram of coke every day for two weeks. I'm glad I stopped that. But then I'd go through bursts where I'd buy coke (anywhere between 1g and 3.5g/an eight ball) and finish it over 1-3 days, feel like shit and stop for a while, then go back to it. But I don't do any drugs anymore.
Egg whites! 17 cal for an egg white means you could have 5 and be under 100 calories. Add some veggies and you've got a low calorie, high protein, tasty, filling meal.
Omg YAS. I drink a bottle with my "dinner" ever night and it helps me feel full. And the flavors are sooo good.
YAAAAAAAS! Congrats girl!
Lol once I saw either a manatee or a sea lion at Newport Beach and it was laying on a docked boat sunbathing. Actual snapshot of myself lmao
Ahh makes sense. Thank you!
Nooooo! You are a beautiful delicate flower 3
I also lose from my thighs last! My upper body looks *so* thin, but then from the hips down I look like a cow.
Anytime, babe!

Please see your therapist. This is not a tunnel you want to go down, trust me. My parents have literally spent hundreds of thousands of dollars on treatment for me in the last 8 years, only for me to end up like this again. I've wasted so much money on tuition only to drop classes because I've been too weak/tired to attend and do my work. I've wasted so much of my teen years and now my 20's, which are supposed to be the best years of my life. I am single and lonely because anything involving food makes me shut down. *Please* run away from the idea of this disorder. No one in their right mind would ever do this to themselves.
So glad our talk helped you out! Congrats on reaching your goal 3

Keep a calendar that keeps track of their successful restricting?
I've been counting my days of continuous restricting/fasting, yes. My longest was 16 days. Today marks my 12th continuous day! A few minutes ago I also wrote my scheduled weight for every day. I'm losing roughly 0.4 pounds per day so I calculated that by the last day of June I'll be 90 pounds if the pattern remains the same (although I suspect as my weight gets lower, my progress will slow down).

As /u/Glitter_Cunt said it is quite offensive that you want to "start" anorexia. Anorexia is not a diet or lifestyle. You cannot "start" it or "work towards" it. You're romanticizing it so much and it makes me feel like crap because I absolutely hate having this disorder.
How is that working regarding hair and nail growth? I have really long hair but with restricting I've been losing a lot/it's become very thin.
I'm sorry you feel that way but trust me, you do not want this disorder.

Well, I've recently learned that vitamins are kind of useless if you're heavily restricting/fasting because you need some sort of substance in your body already in order for them to work. Vitamins *supplement* the nutrients in your body, they don't add or replace the nutrients you're lacking. Have you tried the chewable/gummy vitamins?
That's the term I was looking for! Skinny fat! And thank you!

I was the same exact height back then...this is a dumb question but is it possible I was growing in other areas besides height? Something was different. Looking back at pictures from then, I had *such* a chub little face where as now I have very sharp facial features and a really defined jawline.

WRITING.TITLE: I don't understand my body!
WRITING.TEXT: So I weighed in at 115.2 today (yay, I'm losing ~0.4 pounds per day). When I was a teenager and I weighed this weight (even 5 pounds lighter tbh) I don't recall looking as thin as I do now. Obviously I'm by no means *thin* but I'm thinner (does that make sense even??). I don't think I felt this "thin" until I was 105ish as a teen. The only difference between now and then is that now I'm an athlete (riding horses and all that shit) so is it possible I have more muscle/less fat now compared to when I was a teenager? I was totally sedentary as a teenager besides PE twice a week. Or is my mind/body dysmorphia just playing tricks on me? I've gotten much bonier since losing the last 2-4 pounds and I seriously don't recall being this bony when I weighed the same as a kid.

Awesome! 111 is my lowest adult weight and this morning I weighed in at 115.2! So close. Congrats to you!
And I totally know what you mean about the clothes things. My size 4 jeans/size 26 breeches are getting ridiculous at the hips/waist. My breeches are low rise but because they're so big, they look *high rise* and stupid on me. I don't want to buy any new clothes until I absolutely cannot get away with wearing any of my current clothes.

Breakfast: Nothing
Lunch (planned): Oatmeal (120) + 1 scoop protein powder (120)
Dinner (planned): 2 vegetarian sausage patties (140) + 3 egg whites (51)
Exercise: Horse riding (211)
Total: 431-211 = **220 net calories**

Do you have a therapist? If so, you should definitely talk to them about how you feel, no matter how uncomfortable it might make you. Really, a therapist is there to help you! If you want to lose weight and think it'll make you happy, that's fine, go for it! But a therapist will be able to help you figure out why you feel such a strong desire to go to an extreme and attain a horrible disease like anorexia. Once you work with your therapist to identify this, you and the therapist will come up with a way to get you out of that mindset and give you tools to work towards healthy weight loss.
I understand you want to be thin, but please, please, please hear me out when I say I wouldn't wish an eating disorder upon my worst enemy.

I don't mean this to be rude or condescending or belittling or invalidating in any way but do you have a therapist? What you're going through is clearly causing you a lot of pain (I struggled with self harm a LOT as a teenager, half a decade later my left arm is still completely fucked up). Also, desiring another mental illness is...a whole other issue.
I don't know how many posts you've read on this sub but majority of people with eating disorders are suffering. I, for one, feel fatter and fatter as the scale drops. It's a total mindfuck but I at least can identify that there are deeper issues within myself besides simply wanting to be thin. If I could just eat healthy and exercise to get thin, I would. Hell, I've tried it! I was recovered for a while, gained a bit of weight and tried to lose weight the healthy way. I even had a goal weight in the healthy range! But my eating disorder got triggered and...I've relapsed. I don't enjoy starving myself. I don't enjoy feeling sick, tired, weak, braindead. I don't enjoy isolating myself from my friends and family out of fear of food. I LOVE my friends and family and I miss them dearly. But eating disorders are all consuming and forbid me from seeing them.
I love food and I miss food but I literally cannot get myself to eat even 10 calories more than I planned on without feeling like crying, without feeling like a failure. Please do not wish you had anorexia or any eating disorder. Every waking moment feels like I'm burning in hell. Please do not aspire to be this way, it's not glamorous or beautiful.
Mods: I hope this doesn't break rule 3, 4 or 5.

I just try to remind myself that eating more will either stall my progress on the scale or cause me to gain weight. I *live* to see the number on the scale go down, so I know eating more will hinder that and I'll feel like shit the next day.

All the time. Mainly with my collar bones and shoulder/upper back/shoulder blades area since that area is getting bonier. Sometimes with my upper spine, too. I try to consciously not do it because I'm pretty sure to the average person I look really strange doing it.
